hook.text: You can't have 1,000 real friends. Your brain literally doesn't have the capacity. The limit is about 150.

topics.title: Why Friends Make You Live Longer

hook.text: It takes about 200 hours of time together for someone to become a close friend. Acquaintances happen in 50.

hook.text: Your best friend is probably someone you met because they happened to be nearby â€” not because of destiny.

hook.text: Soldiers who survive battle together form bonds that last a lifetime. Shared struggle is friendship's accelerator.

topics.title: Similarity: Why We Befriend Our Mirrors

hook.text: Your friends probably share your education level, political views, and music taste. Coincidence? Not at all.

buildup.text: Homophily â€” the tendency to befriend similar people â€” is one of the strongest patterns in social science.

discovery.text: A study of 1 million Facebook friendships confirmed: we cluster with people who look, think, and live like us.

climax.text: We're drawn to mirrors. But the most enriching friendships are with people who challenge us, not just agree.

topics.title: Humor: The Secret Glue of Friendship

hook.text: Aristotle classified friendship 2,400 years ago. His framework is still the best one we have.

buildup.text: He identified three types: friendships of utility, of pleasure, and of virtue â€” each with different depths.

discovery.text: Utility friends serve a purpose. Pleasure friends share fun. Virtue friends admire each other's character.

hook.text: You spend more time with your coworkers than your family. But would you see them if you quit?

hook.text: They've never met in person, but they talk every day. She trusts her online friend more than her neighbor.

hook.text: In 1990, 33% of Americans said they had 10+ close friends. In 2023, that number dropped to 13%.

topics.title: Why Making Friends as an Adult Is So Hard

hook.text: At 25, friends found you. At 35, you have to go find them â€” and the process feels awkward and forced.

twist.text: Adults who join recurring groups â€” teams, classes, clubs â€” report friendship rates similar to their school years.

hook.text: Your best friend posts a photo with someone else and calls them 'my person.' Your stomach drops.
